comment: The work required for this course is not difficult, but there is. A LOT of it. Prof Garziano gives great feedback and is always clear in her instructions, but is a very tough grader. Tests are 100% based on her lectures and the textbook which you need to read. Not an easy A class. There are two required performances and a lot of DBA's.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: For a 1000 level class, she doesnt treat it as such. A lot of work and a tough grader. Most of the assignments are pretty pointless as well. Final assignment is stupid and VERY HARD if you are not tech savvy as you have to make a presentation and upload it to youtube with background music and all. Dont take her if you want an easy A or even a B

This is a class you have to put in a lot of time and effort in order to make a good grade. You are given a good amount of time to finish assignments, but don't wait until the last minute. The final project is difficult if you aren't good with technology because you have to make a video in iMovie or another movie making program.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Garziano clearly has a love for theatre and her students. The work is very tedious and a lot. You have to read a lot of plays and do a lot of discussion posts, as well as voice threads. Her quizzes are kinda hard, but if you put in the work in the class you'll get an A. Lectures are very long and quizzes have lockdown browser.

I took her for online theatre for my first semester of college. I wasnt expecting for it to be easy, but definitely not as hard as it actually was. You need to read so many pointless plays and watch her lectures in which she literally screams into the mic. Grades so roughly. Would not recommend taking Garziano for this course if its required.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very accessible outside of class. Make sure you do the homework and go to the required performances and you should be fine. There is a video project final, but she gives more than enough time to complete it and is ready to help if you shoot her a quick email.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is very knowledgeable about the course material. There was a lot of work required for the month-long version of this class. The assignments aren't hard, but they take a while. I spent around 10-18 hours per week to complete my assignments, though I have overdone a couple. Assignments were graded quickly and fairly for the most part.

As a professor she was great. She responds quickly to emails. The amount of work she gives is like for a 3 credit course class. The work is not hard, its just so much while trying to study for other classes. Final project (powerpoint/imovie) is a pain in the butt! Tests are bases on her lectures. You have to read long plays and she tests' you on it

I took this class online and it was easy. You have to attend a few performances and read a few plays and write papers on them. She was always available via email and cared about the class. You don't have to perform, but you do have to make a movie from Power Point as the final project. It's not too hard and she gives you plenty of time.

I really enjoyed this professor. Her assignments are not too hard, but they do take a lot of effort and time. There are 2 required events to attend (and I had her online). I would not recommend buying the book. Save your money and find the plays online. The final project is a "movie" that you narrate about a story in your life. She loves detail!

Ms. Garziano was an excellent professor who cared about her work. Her course was fairly straight forward and you get the opportunity to take quizzes twice and the quizzes aren't particularly difficult so you have a high chance of passing the first time. There is a required play attendance even for the online course so be prepared to attend. c
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I actually enjoyed this course more than I anticipated. There a good deal of reading, but I found the reading material to be so interesting, that I could have been reading for personal pleasure. Prof. Garziano is very accessible, and makes the material/lectures very engaging. She requires that you do your BEST work. Mediocre work WILL NOT cut it!

Professor Garziano is a great professor that I would recommend to take.  Her lectures are informative, she is very responsive to emails,  and she has given me a clear understanding of the many ways that theater impacts our society.  Most importantly for me, she was very understanding of the fact that I am a new father.  Find comfort in taking her!!

Prof. Garziano is an amazing professor at KSU! I really did enjoy TPS 1107 through out. She did give a good amount of assignments but that was expected for an online class. It is an easy class if you follow directions and do the work. Don't be lazy and expect to do the assignments last minute because your grade will reflect that.

This is the best online class I have ever taken in regards to how clear and present the professor is. Clear directions, weekly posts and videos to keep you updated on what to do. The class has a decent amount of work that you have to do but it isn't too hard by any means. Do the work she gives you and you will get an A.

I took this class online and Dr. Garziano was amazing, the assignments were pretty long but really not bad at all for an online class. As long as you actually do the assignments with some amount of thought then you'll make a good grade in the class. Don't do the assignments and don't put in any effort? You'll fail. But this is college, buckle down.
Took this class thinking it would be an easy A+ class to substitute for an art elective. She assigns long af assignments. She grades hard af. Don't take her unless its required for your major.

She has a good spirit and is a true lover of the arts. These qualities create a good teacher she really cares and puts forth an effort to help her students. I took her online class and those discussions are worth more than a quiz if u don't do them your grade will take a hit. she is vague about the final postproject butshe breaks it down into easy

Fundamental course for developing an acting foundation,  participation is mandatory.  You have scene work and a monologue to present, which is hard and nerve racking for most, but she understands and I guarantee you will walk out of her class more confident then ever even if your a non major. FUN COURSE!!!

Professor Garziano is so awesome! Her class is a blast! Just be ready to participate and do all the work required. This class is a easy and fun way to make an A. Do not miss more than 2 classes though because she will take points off. She is so helpful and gives the best advicefeedback on acting. TAKE HER!!!!!

She asks you to buy a custom textbook, I didn't. She posts lectures on what you're supposed to read. Quizzes are easy. She clearly tells you what you need to do each week. It's a lot of assignments, but they're easy. You can go to extra credit performances. 2 required performances. You have to make a video for your final. I would take her again!

Professor Garziano is GREAT. She is very clear and easy to understand. She lays out everything you need to do. Just be sure to check in often and not to procrastinate because she asks for high participation in her class. She brings a new perspective and encourages free thought/debate between classmates making it fun & interesting. Highly recommend!

Instruction is completely from the book. She does not let you know in course description or the syllabus that your final exam DBA is to include video with voice over and is to be uploaded to you tube. This assignment is worth 70 of 500 points.  If I had known about this, I would have switched classes during add/drop. I ended up with a B.

I had Dori for acting 1. She tells you everything is looking for in a paper and everything performance. It is an acting class and you will have to act...Also as a note to those about TPS1107 they all make you do a play at the end...for proper appreciation for the art you have to put yourself in it...
Awesome, awesome professor! I wish she taught every class!

SUPER sweet! Really focuses on table work in terms of acting, but that's more of a dptmt thing from the sound of it. Buy the play, but you get away with not getting the principles of acting book. Most of it's common sense. Easy quizzes and assignments. Just be nice to her and respect her and come to class and she'll like you. Otherwise you'll fail.

I really dont live her class. First of all you Must go to all kinds of shows and write reviews that are useless. Her directions for these responses to the shows are never clear. U have to do a play in the final, which means if your unlucky to be in a bad group oh well ur not getting A.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER. She makes you put on a play as the final, which wouldn't be so bad if she actually had some sort of direction for it. She thinks that all the students are theater majors or should be. She is never clear about what she wants and always changes what she said. AVOID HER.
Fairly easy class. Goes by the syllabus. Attendance only mandatory on certain days. Works alot on vista (quizes & tests). I def dont like theatre but overall the class is pretty chill and easy.

She is very nice and sort of helpful. This is my second acting class and I like her teaching style better but she's definitely not the easiest grader. Attendance is mandatory as it is with all TPS classes. Try hard, go to the plays, and rehearse, rehearse, REHEARSE! Overall, I'd probably take her again with qualms if I had to.

I was deathly afraid of taking Acting. I am a TPS major but definitely backstage work. She made it easier for me to conquer my extreme fears of being on stage pretending to be someone else. She had many hints and tips for me and was always willing to work with me. I highly recommend her.

I really enjoyed Dori's class, she was down to earth and made the class challenging, but fun. Be prepared to do some out of class rehersals for grades. It's a great class to make friends, and she is always willing to help if you have questions
I dont think she is mean just passionate about her subject and career. The class is overall easy attendance is key to passing test.Reading assignments are mandatory.
